Author: Bradley Wuthrich
Stars: Rated 3 stars out of five stars
Text: The privacy policy us almost as bad as Schlage's. Like most corporations they share with their partners which makes sense; however, how that information is protected and used beyond them is unspecified and not protected by the privacy policy. I would prefer apps and devices independent of GPS tracking, cloud based services, and data collection. They should work independently of their creators. I like IP enabled devices that can be managed outside of their creators. I would be more comfortable with Quickset if they offered an app and device that did not collect or connect online. Just solely Bluetooth & NFC

Sometimes I log off and back on the app works and sometimes it doesn't. I'm having the same issue on a second phone an iPhone 6. These are both Kevo 1st generation deadbolts. Same issue with both locks.

My IPhone 6, fails almost every time. The iPhone 7 works well, and my old note 4 works every single time. It's a terribly frustrating system from a reliability standpoint.

Author: Deric Jennings
Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: I love the locks, they work great, when the software works. The problem is not with the physical locks(that's a good thing) the problem is with the software for the locks. The app loses the locks and will not connect anymore. This system works great for about a day or two, then I can't connect and have to completely uninstall the app, clear the data, reset my phone, reinstall the app, sign back in and then the system works great again... Of course, in the time that takes me, I could just pull out my old keys and be in the house with a cold one. Please fix this app, I really want this to work. I invested two locks and want to add the plus system and a convert to my third door. However, if you can't keep up with the software development, I can't use you and that sucks. Please fix the software.

Author: Aaron Wallace
Stars: Rated 5 stars out of five stars
Text: Works as I would expect. The instructions said it would not be compatible with my existing lock however it came with everything I needed even if I had no existing lock. The app started off a little finicky due to the verification process. Just remember to close the app after completing the verification process then opening it and starting your ekeying procedures. I use the same account on both my phone and my wife's phone so I did not have to generate another set of keys however this may cause me issues later, I guess I will find out. I love the fact that it does not connect to the Internet so it being hacked is less of a worry. Locks do not need access to the internet due to your phone being able to program them locally and you can email the ekey to someone if they need to get in without you being home. I have not tried this yet but hopefully will soon. The only issue I have at the moment is the possibility of your phone being too close to the lock while being home which can allow someone to walk up and unlock your door if your phone is too close. That can be solved by simply turning off your Bluetooth while at home but that is not something people will like to do. So far it works great with no issues.

Stars: Rated 1 stars out of five stars
Text: Intrusive and poorly designed. Constant notification on your phone that says "your Kevo is running"... No kidding, it'd better be, for the huge cost of the thing! I shouldn't have to deal with your advertising when I've paid you hundreds of dollars got a product I'm literally using multiple times everyday anyway! If you block the stupid notification then you can't get notifications about lock events. And, BTW, it forces you to receive [useless] emails as well as push notifications for those events. AND you have to set up each event (lock and unlock) separately for each individual key-holder! Even being the best most convenient smart lock on the market they make it very hard to justify paying their insanely high price for the thing with this absolutely garbage app. Oh and BTW it doesn't work with Google Assistant like the rest of their smart locks, and everyone else's, for that matter.

The Kevo does not link with the home automation hub, Wink, not sure if it works with Samsung or Apple's automation products, remote access requires their junk. The lock doesn't work if you're already paired to a bluetooth device. The app force closes on my Moto360 watch. The lock is very loud, both mechanically as well as the beep tones if you leave them enabled. This one is going back to the store, I'll stick with a good old regular z-wave lock, my Wink hub loves z-wave. If someone is going to break in, I'd rather it be a hacker than a kid with a screwdriver. Nest integration works ***great. You lock the door and it tells the Nest to cook the remaining occupants in the house.

Stars: Rated 4 stars out of five stars
Text: They're getting better! The customer support is extremely slow, and not very helpful at times, but the warranty is handled well, I had to have mine replaced twice, didn't cost me a single penny... (once it was even my fault, I ripped some wires off the curcuit board accidentally! ). One cool feature is the re-key, which lets u use ur current or existing door key assuming its the same brand as your kevo (mine is by kwikset). This also works if you have multiple doors, no matter how many, one key does the job for all of them
